page.title: 15Gt.Coxwell after 1100 A.D.
page.content: The church of St.Giles is 12th century with later tower and many alterations. On 3 sides there are medieval sites. The south wall of Court House & the Great Tithe Barn,built 1250,are the only remains of the 1205 Cistercian Grange.It was dissolved in 1535 and sold to the Morys family. The fields were enclosed in 1659 & no depopulation apparently resulted.The 18th century turnpiking of the A420 & B4019 resulted in the lack of use of three roads,now bridleways and the opening of the Holloway. The school opened 1865 & closed 1965. The Methodist Chapel,built 1875 closed about 1950.In 1953 there was a meal there to celebrate Elizabeth II's Coronation.The Parish Reading Room was opened in 1900 & is still in use. The public house,the Royal Oak,was closed in about 1962.
